name: Tabular
headline: AI Copilot for accounting firms in Europe
description: Tabular uses AI to automate the core workflows of accounting firms, starting in Europe. We generate finished ledger entries that users export with just one click. This involves tasks like booking expense accounts, determining VAT filings, reconciling transactions.

founders.name: Tim Hermes, Founder
founders.description: Tim previously built software for accountants at Taxfix (Unicorn) and scaled it from scratch to multiple millions ARR in under 12 Months. He studied Economics at Berkeley and Ludwig-Maximilians University.

founders.name: Markus Jungnickel, Founder
founders.description: Markus studied Law & Business at Cambridge, where he graduated top of his class, and holds an MSc in Computing Science from Imperial College. He previously worked on launching new financial services at the European fintech unicorn Trade Republic (backed by Sequoia, Founders Fund, Creandum).

founders.name: Kilian Justus, Founder
founders.description: Kilian has launched tax filing products in Italy and France as product manager at Taxfix (Index, TGV). He was employee #1 at genova.ai, a B2C AI product studio, and studied at Williams College and Oxford.

founders.name: Leo von Kleist, Founder
founders.description: Leo previously cofounded Hive. As CTO, he helped build an all-in-one e-commerce operations software that reached 8-digit ARR. The company has raised more than $60M from investors including Tiger Global. He studied computer science at ETH Zürich and has worked as an ML Engineer.

generated_description:
Tabular is an innovative startup that kicked off in 2024, with a clear mission to serve as an AI Copilot for accounting firms in Europe. Their goal is straightforward: simplify and enhance the bookkeeping process for accountants by leveraging cutting-edge technology.

At its core, Tabular automates essential workflows for accountants, primarily targeting the European market. The platform generates ready-to-export ledger entries with a single click—covering crucial tasks such as expense account bookings, VAT filings, and transaction reconciliations. This allows firms to reduce manual effort significantly, freeing up valuable time to focus on more strategic aspects of their businesses.

Founded within the environment of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Tabular is a compact team of five individuals, all passionate about revolutionizing the accounting sector. Their approach emphasizes efficiency; firm users can onboard in under 45 minutes and immediately start leveraging advanced features. For example, the AI quickly categorizes invoices, sorts out duplicates, and even automates complex bookings from day one.

The company is also tightly integrated with existing platforms like DATEV, a common accounting software in Germany, making the process seamless for users who wish to export their data easily. Beyond automation, Tabular aims to position accountants as modern advisors rather than just number crunchers, helping firms acquire more clients and expand their services.

Dalton Caldwell, a partner at Y Combinator, is onboard as a group partner, which further validates their potential in the competitive landscape of fintech startups.

To sum it up, Tabular is reshaping accounting for contemporary firms by reducing tedious tasks through automation, allowing accountants to focus on delivering higher value to their clients. If you’re an accounting firm seeking to boost efficiency and client satisfaction, it might be worth checking out Tabular at their website: [gotabular.de](https://www.gotabular.de/en/).
